#Text=Connect to a PolarDB for MySQL cluster
#Text=Connect to a PolarDB for MySQL cluster
#Text=Connect to a PolarDB for MySQL cluster
#Text=This topic describes how to use Data Management Service (DMS) or a MySQL client to
#Text=connect to a PolarDB for MySQL cluster.
#Text=A privileged account or standard account is created for a PolarDB for MySQL cluster.
#Text=For more information, see Create a database account.
#Text=Use DMS to connect to a PolarDB for MySQL cluster
#Text=DMS is a visualized data management service provided by Alibaba Cloud.
#Text=various management services, such as data management, schema management, access control,
#Text=BI charts, data trends, data tracking, performance optimization, and server management.
#Text=DMS supports relational databases such as MySQL, SQL Server, and PostgreSQL, as well
#Text=as NoSQL databases such as MongoDB and Redis.
#Text=In the upper-left corner of the console, select the region where the cluster resides.
#Text=Find the cluster, and then click the cluster ID.
#Text=In the upper-right corner of the Overview page, click Log On to Database.
#Text=In the dialog box that appears, specify Database Account and Database Password that are created in the PolarDB for MySQL cluster, and click Login.
#Text=Note The account that is used to log on must have the permissions on the specified database.
#Text=Otherwise, you cannot find the specified database in the left-side navigation pane
#Text=For more information about how to modify the permissions of a
#Text=database account, see Modify the permissions of a standard account.
#Text=After you log on to DMS, refresh the page.
#Text=On the Logged in instance page, click the cluster name and double-click the database name.
#Text=Use a client to connect to a PolarDB for MySQL cluster
#Text=You can use a MySQL client to connect a PolarDB cluster.
#Text=In the lower-left corner of the session manager, click New.
#Text=Enter the information of the PolarDB cluster to be connected.
#Text=Enter the public or internal endpoint of the PolarDB cluster.
#Text=If the client runs on an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance that is deployed in
#Text=the same region and has the same network type as the PolarDB cluster, use the internal endpoint.
#Text=For example, if the ECS instance and PolarDB cluster are deployed in a virtual private cloud (VPC) in the China (Hangzhou) region,
#Text=you can use the internal endpoint to establish a secure and fast connection.
#Text=Use the public endpoint for other scenarios.
#Text=To view the endpoint and port information of the PolarDB cluster, perform the following steps:
#Text=In the upper-left corner of the page, select the region where the cluster that you
#Text=Find the cluster and click the cluster ID.
#Text=You can view the endpoint and port information on the Overview page.
#Text=The account that is used to connect to the PolarDB cluster.
#Text=The port number of the public or internal endpoint for the PolarDB cluster.
#Text=If the connection information is valid, you can connect to the cluster.
#Text=Use the command-line interface (CLI) to connect to a PolarDB for MySQL cluster
#Text=If MySQL is installed on your server, you can run the following command in the command-line
#Text=interface (CLI) to connect to a PolarDB for MySQL cluster:
#Text=The public or internal endpoint of the PolarDB cluster.
#Text=For more information, see View or apply for an endpoint.
#Text=The port number of the PolarDB cluster.
#Text=If you use the internal endpoint, you must enter the internal port number of the PolarDB cluster.
#Text=If you use the public endpoint, you must enter the public port number of the PolarDB cluster.
#Text=If you use the default port, you do not need to specify this parameter.
#Text=The account that is used to connect to the PolarDB cluster.
#Text=If you do not specify this parameter, you are required to enter the password when
#Text=If you specify this parameter, do not enter a space character between -p and the password.
#Text=The name of the database to which you want to connect.
#Text=You can enter only the database name and exclude -D.
#Text=The default whitelist contains only the IP address 127.0.0.1. 127.0.0.1 indicates that no IP address is allowed to access the PolarDB cluster.
#Text=Therefore, you must add IP addresses to the whitelist.
#Text=see Configure a whitelist for a cluster.
#Text=Notice 0.0.0.0/0 indicates that all IP addresses are allowed to access the PolarDB cluster
#Text=The public IP addresses that you add to the whitelist are invalid.
#Text=public IP address may be a dynamic IP address.
#Text=The tools or websites that are used
#Text=to query the public IP addresses provide invalid IP addresses.
#Text=The wrong internal or public endpoint is used.
#Text=The connection fails when you use an internal endpoint to connect over the Internet
#Text=or use a public endpoint to connect through an internal network.
#Text=If you want to connect to the PolarDB cluster through an internal network, you must use the internal endpoint of the PolarDB cluster.
#Text=If you want to connect to the PolarDB cluster over the Internet, you must use the public endpoint of the PolarDB cluster.
#Text=The network types of the ECS instance and the PolarDB cluster are different.
#Text=The ECS instance is deployed in the classic network while
#Text=the PolarDB cluster is deployed in a VPC.
#Text=Solution 1 (recommended): Migrate the ECS instance to the same VPC.
#Text=Note The ECS instance and the PolarDB cluster must be deployed in the same VPC to communicate
#Text=with each other through the internal network.
#Text=Solution 2: Use the ClassicLink feature to establish an internal network connection between the ECS instance in the
#Text=classic network and the PolarDB cluster in the VPC.
#Text=Solution 3: Connect the ECS instance to the PolarDB cluster over the Internet by using the public endpoint of the cluster.
#Text=provides the lowest security, stability, and performance.
